feed.title: Stichting Oekra√Øners in Nederland / Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation
feed.subtitle: Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation (Stichting Oekra√Øners in Nederland) is a non-profit platform established in 2014 to support the needs of the Dutch Ukrainian diaspora.

entry.title: –¢—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–µ —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –î–Ω—è –ù–µ–∑–∞–ª–µ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –≤ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö
entry.content:
üá∫üá¶

24 —Å–µ—Ä–ø–Ω—è 2025-–≥–æ —Ä–æ–∫—É —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥–∞ –≤ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö –≤—ñ–¥–∑–Ω–∞—á–∏–ª–∞ –î–µ–Ω—å –ù–µ–∑–∞–ª–µ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –Ω–µ –ª–∏—à–µ –º–æ–ª–∏—Ç–≤–æ—é –π –æ—Ñ—ñ—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏–º–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–º–æ–≤–∞–º–∏, –∞ –π —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏–º —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è–º ‚Äú–Ω–∞ —á–æ–≤–Ω–∞—Ö‚Äù. –ó–∞—Ö—ñ–¥ –±—É–≤ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ñ–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –§—É–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—î—é ¬´–£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Ü—ñ –≤ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö¬ª. –£ –ì–∞–∞–∑—ñ, –ì—Ä–æ–Ω—ñ–Ω–≥–µ–Ω—ñ, –•–∞—Ä–ª–µ–º—ñ —Ç–∞ –ú–∞–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ö—Ç—ñ –¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∫–∏ —á–æ–≤–Ω—ñ–≤ —ñ–∑ —Å–∏–Ω—å–æ-–∂–æ–≤—Ç–∏–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–ø–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏ –≤–∏—Ä—É—à–∏–ª–∏ —É —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫–æ–≤–∏–π –∑–∞–ø–ª–∏–≤. –ö–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏ –≥–æ–ª–ª–∞–Ω–¥—Å—å–∫–∏—Ö –º—ñ—Å—Ç —Ü—å–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è –∑–∞–∑–≤—É—á–∞–ª–∏ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–º–∏ –ø—ñ—Å–Ω—è–º–∏, —Å–º—ñ—Ö–æ–º —ñ —Ä–æ–∑–º–æ–≤–∞–º–∏, –∞ –≤–∏—à–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∫–∏ —Ç–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á–∫–∏ —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∏ –æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤—É –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—É —î–¥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ.

üìç –£ –ì—Ä–æ–Ω—ñ–Ω–≥–µ–Ω—ñ —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ä–æ–∑–ø–æ—á–∞–ª–æ—Å—è –∑ –º–æ–ª–∏—Ç–≤–∏ —Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–º–æ–≤–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∞ –ü–æ—Å–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏, –ø—ñ—Å–ª—è —á–æ–≥–æ —É—á–∞—Å–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –≤–∏—Ä—É—à–∏–ª–∏ —É —Å–ø—ñ–ª—å–Ω—É –ø–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏ –º—ñ—Å—Ç–∞.

üìç –£ –ì–∞–∞–∑—ñ –ø—ñ—Å–ª—è –í—Å–µ—É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–ª–µ–±–Ω—é –∑–∞ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—É —Ç–∞ –≤–∏—Å—Ç—É–ø—ñ–≤ –ø–æ—á–µ—Å–Ω–∏—Ö –≥–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ –¥–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∏—Å—è –¥–æ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ—ó ‚Äî —á–æ–≤–Ω–∏ –∑ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–º–∏ –¥—ñ–∞—Å–ø–æ—Ä—è–Ω–∞–º–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–ª–∏–ª–∏ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏ –º—ñ—Å—Ç–∞.

üìç –£ –•–∞—Ä–ª–µ–º—ñ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Ü—ñ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ –¥–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –¥–æ –∑–∞–ø–ª–∏–≤—ñ–≤ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏ –º—ñ—Å—Ç–∞, –ø—Ä–∏–∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—à–∏ —á–æ–≤–Ω–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–ø–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏ —Ç–∞ —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª—ñ–∫–æ—é. –¢—É—Ç —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –º–∞–ª–æ –∑–∞—Ç–∏—à–Ω–∏–π —ñ –¥—Ä—É–∂–Ω—ñ–π —Ö–∞—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä: —Ä–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∏ —Ç–∞ –¥—Ä—É–∑—ñ –∑—ñ–±—Ä–∞–ª–∏—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º, —â–æ–± —É –Ω–µ–≤–∏–º—É—à–µ–Ω—ñ–π –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—ñ –≤—ñ–¥—á—É—Ç–∏ —î–¥–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å —ñ —Ä–∞–¥—ñ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–µ–∑–∞–ª–µ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ. –î—è–∫—É—î–º–æ –∑–∞ —Å–ø—ñ–≤–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ñ–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä—É ‚Äì –ì–û Haarlem For Ukraine.

üìç –£ –ú–∞–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ö—Ç—ñ –∑–∞–ø–ª–∏–≤ —Å—Ç–∞–≤ —è—Å–∫—Ä–∞–≤–∏–º —Å–≤—ñ–¥—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è–º –∑–≥—É—Ä—Ç–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø—ñ–≤–¥–Ω—ñ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥—ñ–≤. –£—á–∞—Å–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –ø–æ–¥—ñ–ª–∏–ª–∏—Å—è —Ç–µ–ø–ª–∏–º–∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º–∏, —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–º–∏ –ø—ñ—Å–Ω—è–º–∏ —Ç–∞ —Å–º–∞–∫–æ–ª–∏–∫–∞–º–∏, —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏–≤—à–∏ –≤—ñ–¥—á—É—Ç—Ç—è –º–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫–æ–≥–æ —à–º–∞—Ç–æ—á–∫–∞ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –¥–∞–ª–µ–∫–æ –≤—ñ–¥ –¥–æ–º—É. –î—è–∫—É—î–º–æ –∑–∞ —Å–ø—ñ–≤–ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞–º ‚Äì –ì–û –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–π –¥—ñ–º –≤ –ú–∞–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ö—Ç—ñ.

–¶–µ–π –¥–µ–Ω—å –Ω–∞–≥–∞–¥–∞–≤ –Ω–∞–º, —â–æ –Ω–µ–∑–∞–ª–µ–∂–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å ‚Äî —Ü–µ –Ω–µ –ª–∏—à–µ –¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–≤–Ω–∏–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å, –∞ –π —â–æ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏—Å—É—Ç–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ —É —Å–µ—Ä—Ü—è—Ö —ó—ó –ª—é–¥–µ–π, –¥–µ –± –≤–æ–Ω–∏ –Ω–µ –±—É–ª–∏. üíôüíõ –î—è–∫—É—î–º–æ –≤—Å—ñ–º, —Ö—Ç–æ –¥–æ–ª—É—á–∏–≤—Å—è –¥–æ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ñ–∑–∞—Ü—ñ—ó —Ç–∞ —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è, —ñ —á–µ–∫–∞—î–º–æ –Ω–∞ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ñ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á—ñ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—ó –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥–∏ –≤ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö! –û–∫—Ä–µ–º–∞ –≤–¥—è—á–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å –ú—ñ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤—É –∑ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω—å –ø—Ä–∏—Ç—É–ª–∫—É —Ç–∞ –º—ñ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—ó –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥—ñ–≤ (Ministerie van Asiel en Migratie) –∑–∞ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∫—É –∑–∞—Ö–æ–¥—ñ–≤.

üá¨üáß

2On 24 August, the Ukrainian community in the Netherlands celebrated Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day not only with prayers and official speeches but also with the traditional boat cruises. The event was organised by the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation. In The Hague, Groningen, Haarlem and Maastricht, dozens of boats with blue-and-yellow flags set off on festive journeys. The canals of Dutch cities were filled with Ukrainian songs, laughter and conversations, while embroidered shirts and ribbons created a special atmosphere of unity.

üìç In Groningen, the celebration began with a prayer and a speech from the representative of the Embassy of Ukraine, after which participants embarked on a shared voyage through the city‚Äôs canals.

üìç In The Hague, after the All-Ukrainian prayer service for Ukraine and the speeches of honoured guests, the community also joined the tradition ‚Äî boats with Ukrainians traveled through the canals of the city.

üìç In Haarlem, Ukrainians also took to the city‚Äôs canals, decorating the boats with flags and national symbols. The celebration there had a cosy and friendly atmosphere: families and friends gathered together to feel the unity and joy of independence in an informal setting. We thank our partners NGO Haarlem For Ukraine for partnering in organising this event in Haarlem.

üìç In Maastricht, the boat rally became a vivid testimony of the community‚Äôs solidarity in the south of the Netherlands. Participants shared warm words, Ukrainian songs and homemade treats, creating the feeling of a small piece of Ukraine far away from home. We thank our partners NGO Ukrainian House in Maastricht for partnering in organising this event in Maastricht.

This day reminded us that independence is not only a state status but also the daily presence of Ukraine in the hearts of its people, wherever they may be. üíôüíõ We thank everyone who organized and joined the celebration and look forward to the next gatherings of the Ukrainian community in the Netherlands! Special thanks to the Ministry of Asylum and Migration of the Netherlands (Ministerie van Asiel en Migratie) for supporting the events.

entry.title: Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day Boat Celebration in The Hague: Over a 10-Year Tradition of Unity and Support

link.title: Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day Boat Celebration in The Hague: Over a 10-Year Tradition of Unity and Support

entry.content:
Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day Boat Celebration in The Hague: Over a 10-Year Tradition of Unity and Support Every year, on the occasion of Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day, the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation organises a symbolic boat parade through the canals of The Hague ‚Äî a vibrant event that brings the Ukrainian community together around shared identity and support for Ukraine.

In this way, they want the Dutch to see, hear, and feel Ukraine.

Participants decorate boats with blue and yellow flags, wear traditional embroidered shirts (vyshyvankas), sing Ukrainian songs, and conclude the event with a collective performance of the national anthem right in the middle of the canal. This tradition began in 2014 and is led by the Foundation‚Äôs Chair, Vira Zwan, and Board Member Liudmyla Lisovska. The celebration is regularly attended by the Ambassador of Ukraine to the Netherlands, embassy staff, and the Honorary Consul Karel Dirven.

üìå Highlights of the event:

  • Boat parade through the canals of The Hague with Ukrainian flags, songs, and floral wreaths.
  • Ukrainians dressed in traditional attire, waving national flags.
  • The national anthem of Ukraine sung together on the water.
  • Organised by the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation.
  • A charitable initiative ‚Äî all donations go to support Ukraine.

All the announcements and reports are on our official website, Instagram, and community messenger channels.

Media about us: Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day celebration on the canals of The Hague

üá∫üá¶üá∫üá¶üá∫üá¶

–î–µ–Ω—å –ù–µ–∑–∞–ª–µ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –Ω–∞ —á–æ–≤–Ω–∞—Ö —É –ì–∞–∞–∑—ñ: —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ—è —î–¥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ —Ç–∞ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∫–∏, —è–∫—ñ–π –±—ñ–ª—å—à–µ 10 —Ä–æ–∫—ñ–≤

–©–æ—Ä–æ–∫—É –¥–æ –î–Ω—è –ù–µ–∑–∞–ª–µ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ —Ñ—É–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—è ¬´–£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Ü—ñ –≤ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö¬ª –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ñ–∑–æ–≤—É—î —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª—ñ—á–Ω–∏–π –∑–∞–ø–ª–∏–≤ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏ –ì–∞–∞–≥–∏ ‚Äî —è—Å–∫—Ä–∞–≤—É –ø–æ–¥—ñ—é, —â–æ –æ–±‚Äô—î–¥–Ω—É—î —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—É –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥—É –Ω–∞–≤–∫–æ–ª–æ —Å–ø—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ—ó —ñ–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ —Ç–∞ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∫–∏ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏. –£—á–∞—Å–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –∑–∞—Ö–æ–¥—É –ø—Ä–∏–∫—Ä–∞—à–∞—é—Ç—å —á–æ–≤–Ω–∏ –∂–æ–≤—Ç–æ-–±–ª–∞–∫–∏—Ç–Ω–∏–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–ø–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏, –æ–¥—è–≥–∞—é—Ç—å –≤–∏—à–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∫–∏, —Å–ø—ñ–≤–∞—é—Ç—å —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—ñ –ø—ñ—Å–Ω—ñ –π –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à—É—é—Ç—å –ø–æ–¥—ñ—é —É—Ä–æ—á–∏—Å—Ç–∏–º –≤–∏–∫–æ–Ω–∞–Ω–Ω—è–º –î–µ—Ä–∂–∞–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≥—ñ–º–Ω—É –ø–æ—Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª—É. –¶—é —ñ–Ω—ñ—Ü—ñ–∞—Ç–∏–≤—É –∑–∞–ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ —É 2014 —Ä–æ—Ü—ñ –∑–∞ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç—ñ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏ —Ñ—É–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—ó –í—ñ—Ä–∏ –ó–≤–∞–Ω —Ç–∞ –õ—é–¥–º–∏–ª–∏ –õ—ñ—Å–æ–≤—Å—å–∫–æ—ó, —á–ª–µ–Ω–∫–∏–Ω—ñ –†–∞–¥–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—ñ–Ω–Ω—è –§—É–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—ó. –î–æ —Å–≤—è—Ç–∫—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–æ –¥–æ–ª—É—á–∞—é—Ç—å—Å—è –ü–æ—Å–æ–ª –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –≤ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö, —Å–ø—ñ–≤—Ä–æ–±—ñ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –ü–æ—Å–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ –ø–æ—á–µ—Å–Ω–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥—ñ–≤ –ö–∞—Ä–µ–ª –î—ñ—Ä–≤–µ–Ω.

üìå –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ñ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏ –∑–∞—Ö–æ–¥—É:

  • –ó–∞–ø–ª–∏–≤ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏ –ì–∞–∞–≥–∏ —É –≤–∏—à–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∫–∞—Ö, —ñ–∑ –ø—Ä–∞–ø–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏, –≤—ñ–Ω–∫–∞–º–∏, –ø—ñ—Å–Ω—è–º–∏.
  • –°–∏–º–≤–æ–ª—ñ—á–Ω–∞ —î–¥–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—ó –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥–∏ –∑–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–¥–æ–Ω–æ–º.
  • –ë–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥—ñ–π–Ω–∞ –º–µ—Ç–∞: –∑—ñ–±—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ –∫–æ—à—Ç–∏ —Å–ø—Ä—è–º–æ–≤—É—é—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥—É –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—ñ.
  • –û—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ñ–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä ‚Äî —Ñ—É–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—è ¬´–£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Ü—ñ –≤ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ö¬ª.

–ê–Ω–æ–Ω—Å–∏ —Ç–∞ –∑–≤—ñ—Ç–∏ ‚Äî –Ω–∞ –æ—Ñ—ñ—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–æ–º—É —Å–∞–π—Ç—ñ —Ñ—É–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—ó, Instagram —Ç–∞ –≤ —É—Å—ñ—Ö –º–µ—Å–µ–Ω–¥–∂–µ—Ä–∞—Ö —Å–ø—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Ç–∏.
entry.summary: Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day Boat Celebration in The Hague: Over a 10-Year Tradition of Unity and Support Every year, on the occasion of Ukraine‚Äôs Independence Day, the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation organises a symbolic boat parade through the canals of The Hague ‚Äî a vibrant event that brings the Ukrainian community together around shared identity and support for Ukraine.

entry.title: De jaarrekening van de Stichting 2023, 2024
entry.content:
Jaarrekening 2023
  Tussentijdse cijfers per 30 juni 2024

entry.title: A Symbolic Gesture in The Hague: Defence Ministers Stand with Ukraine on the Peace Square

link.title: A Symbolic Gesture in The Hague: Defence Ministers Stand with Ukraine on the Peace Square

entry.content:
On 23 June, on the eve of the historic 2025 NATO Summit, a peaceful demonstration took place in front of the üïäÔ∏è Peace Palace in The Hague. Organised by the Ukrainian and Lithuanian communities, the event aimed to show solidarity with the North Atlantic Alliance and affirm Ukraine‚Äôs unwavering aspiration to become a full member. It also served as a civic signal: the decisions made at this summit matter ‚Äî for Ukraine, for Europe, and for global security. üåç

The central messages of the rally were:

üîπ ‚ÄúThank you, NATO, for supporting Ukraine‚Äù üîπ ‚ÄúNATO is stronger with Ukraine‚Äù üîπ ‚ÄúUkraine‚Äôs future is in NATO‚Äù üîπ ‚ÄúUkraine‚Äôs NATO membership is inevitable‚Äù

Participants held Ukrainisn, Lithuanian and Dutch flags, along with signs calling for unity, responsibility, and collective security. The image was one of determination ‚Äî a street-level reflection of the values NATO claims to protect.

Two high-ranking guests addressed the crowd: Ruben Brekelmans, Minister of Defence of the Netherlands, and Dovilƒó ≈†akalienƒó, Minister of Defence of Lithuania.

‚ÄúFor the first time in history, Alliance countries will commit to spending 5% on defence,‚Äù said Ruben Brekelmans. ‚ÄúI understand why you feel the urgency. What‚Äôs happening in Ukraine could happen in Lithuania or anywhere in Eastern Europe. It‚Äôs a reminder to all of us in NATO of what‚Äôs at stake.‚Äù

‚ÄúUkraine is Europe. And Europe needs Ukraine‚Äôs experience, expertise, and industrial strength,‚Äù said Minister ≈†akalienƒó. ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt just support ‚Äî it‚Äôs shared responsibility for the future of democracies.‚Äù

üá∫üá¶üá∫üá¶üá∫üá¶

–°–∏–º–≤–æ–ª—ñ—á–Ω–∏–π –∂–µ—Å—Ç —É –ì–∞–∞–∑—ñ: –º—ñ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—Ä–∏ –æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∏ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞–ª–∏ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—É –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–æ—â—ñ –±—ñ–ª—è –ü–∞–ª–∞—Ü—É –º–∏—Ä—É

23 —á–µ—Ä–≤–Ω—è, –Ω–∞–ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–æ–¥–Ω—ñ —ñ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–∞–º—ñ—Ç—É –ù–ê–¢–û 2025, –±—ñ–ª—è –ü–∞–ª–∞—Ü—É –º–∏—Ä—É –≤ –ì–∞–∞–∑—ñ –≤—ñ–¥–±—É–ª–∞—Å—è –º–∏—Ä–Ω–∞ –∞–∫—Ü—ñ—è, –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω—ñ–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∞ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—é —Ç–∞ –ª–∏—Ç–æ–≤—Å—å–∫–æ—é –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥–∞–º–∏. –ú–µ—Ç–æ—é –∑–∞—Ö–æ–¥—É –±—É–ª–æ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∫—É –ü—ñ–≤–Ω—ñ—á–Ω–æ–∞—Ç–ª–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ–º—É –∞–ª—å—è–Ω—Å—É —Ç–∞ —Ä—ñ—à—É—á—ñ—Å—Ç—å –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏ –π–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–≤–Ω–æ—Ü—ñ–Ω–Ω–∏–º —á–ª–µ–Ω–æ–º —Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–¥–∞—Ç–∏ –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥—Å—å–∫–∏–π —Å–∏–≥–Ω–∞–ª –ø—Ä–æ –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ—Å—Ç—å —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω—å, —è–∫—ñ —É—Ö–≤–∞–ª—é—é—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–º—ñ—Ç—ñ.

–ö–ª—é—á–æ–≤–∏–º–∏ –≥–∞—Å–ª–∞–º–∏ –∞–∫—Ü—ñ—ó –±—É–ª–∏:

üîπ ¬´–î—è–∫—É—î–º–æ, –ù–ê–¢–û, –∑–∞ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∫—É –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏¬ª üîπ ¬´–ó –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–æ—é NATO —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ—à–µ¬ª üîπ ¬´–ú–∞–π–±—É—Ç–Ω—î –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –≤ –ù–ê–¢–û¬ª üîπ ¬´–ß–ª–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –≤ –ù–ê–¢–û –Ω–µ–≤—ñ–¥–≤–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–Ω—ñ¬ª.

–£—á–∞—Å–Ω–∏–∫–∏ —Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–ø–æ—Ä–∏ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏, –õ–∏—Ç–≤–∏ —Ç–∞ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥—ñ–≤, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–∂ –ø–ª–∞–∫–∞—Ç–∏ –∑ –ø—Ä–æ–º–æ–≤–∏—Å—Ç–∏–º–∏ –≥–∞—Å–ª–∞–º–∏ –ø—Ä–æ —î–¥–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å, –±–µ–∑–ø–µ–∫—É —Ç–∞ –≤—ñ–¥–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å.

–ü—ñ–¥ —á–∞—Å –º—ñ—Ç–∏–Ω–≥—É –¥–æ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤—ñ—Å—Ç—ñ–≤ –∑–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É–ª–∏—Å—å –†—É–±–µ–Ω –ë—Ä–µ–∫–µ–ª–º–∞–Ω—Å, –º—ñ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—Ä –æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∏ –ù—ñ–¥–µ—Ä–ª–∞–Ω–¥—ñ–≤ —Ç–∞ –î–æ–≤—ñ–ª–µ –®–∞–∫–∞–ª—ñ—î–Ω–µ, –º—ñ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–∫–∞ –æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∏ –õ–∏—Ç–≤–∏.

¬´–í–ø–µ—Ä—à–µ –≤ —ñ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—ó –∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ –ê–ª—å—è–Ω—Å—É –≤—ñ–∑—å–º—É—Ç—å –Ω–∞ —Å–µ–±–µ –∑–æ–±–æ–≤‚Äô—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—è –≤–∏—Ç—Ä–∞—á–∞—Ç–∏ 5% –Ω–∞ –æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—É,¬ª ‚Äî –∑–∞—è–≤–∏–≤ –†—É–±–µ–Ω –ë—Ä–µ–∫–µ–ª–º–∞–Ω—Å. ‚Äî ¬´–Ø —Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—é, —á–æ–º—É –≤–∏ –≤—ñ–¥—á—É–≤–∞—î—Ç–µ —Ç–µ—Ä–º—ñ–Ω–æ–≤—ñ—Å—Ç—å. –¢–µ, —â–æ –≤—ñ–¥–±—É–≤–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—ñ, –º–æ–∂–µ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è –≤ –õ–∏—Ç–≤—ñ —á–∏ –±—É–¥—å-–¥–µ —É –°—Ö—ñ–¥–Ω—ñ–π –Ñ–≤—Ä–æ–ø—ñ. –¶–µ –Ω–∞–≥–∞–¥—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞–º —É—Å—ñ–º —É –ù–ê–¢–û ‚Äî —â–æ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–æ –Ω–∞ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç—É.¬ª

¬´–£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∞ ‚Äî —Ü–µ –Ñ–≤—Ä–æ–ø–∞. –Ü –Ñ–≤—Ä–æ–ø—ñ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω—ñ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–π –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥, –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–Ω—è —Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–º–∏—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏–π –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü—ñ–∞–ª. –¶–µ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∫–∞ ‚Äî —Ü–µ —Å–ø—ñ–≤—É—á–∞—Å—Ç—å —É –º–∞–π–±—É—Ç–Ω—å–æ–º—É –¥–µ–º–æ–∫—Ä–∞—Ç—ñ–π,¬ª ‚Äî –∑–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É–ª–∞—Å—å –¥–æ –≥—Ä–æ–º–∞–¥–∏ –î–æ–≤—ñ–ª–µ –®–∞–∫–∞–ª—ñ—î–Ω–µ, –ú—ñ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–∫–∞ –æ–±–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∏ –õ–∏—Ç–≤–∏.
entry.summary: On 23 June, on the eve of the historic 2025 NATO Summit, a peaceful demonstration took place in front of the üïäÔ∏è Peace Palace in The Hague. Organised by the Ukrainian and Lithuanian communities, the event aimed to show solidarity with the North Atlantic Alliance and affirm Ukraine‚Äôs unwavering aspiration to become a full member. It also served as a civic signal: the decisions made at this summit matter ‚Äî for Ukraine, for Europe, and for global security. üåç

entry.title: Welcome Ukraine üá∫üá¶
entry.content:
¬´Welcome Ukraine üá∫üá¶¬ª ‚Äî is the biggest event of this spring ‚Äòs-Hertogenbosch, dedicated to Ukraine!

On 29 of May 2025 for the second time, ‚Äòs-Hertogenbosch will welcome Ukrainians and their friends, who are supporting Ukraine through this difficult time of full scale invasion. Parade square near the Parochie Sint-Janskathedraal church will embrace everyone to show solidarity, devotion to the struggle of Ukrainian people. Join us! üåª

  • üìÖ Date: 29.05.2025
  • üï∞Ô∏è Time: 13:00-18:30
  • üìçLocation: Parade, ‚Äòs-Hertogenbosch
  • üéØ free of charge

This heartfelt meeting is dedicated to 110 thousand Ukrainian refugees: opening of the event, speeches from official representatives, worships by Dutch and Ukrainian priests, choirs: Makivka and Korali. It might be a great experience for everyone, because you not only will greet your old friends, but might also meet new! You can become a part of a big march with Ukrainian flag, and a concert performed by famous Ukrainian artists!

The program of the day:

  • official opening ceremony of the action on Parade Square, ‚Äòs-Hertogenbosch at 13:00
  • general march with Ukrainian flag üá∫üá¶ ;
  • church service in Sint-Janskathedraalüôè;
  • grand concert with the participation of famous Ukrainian singers: Oleh Skrypka & VV, Patsyki z Franyka, Ivan Navi, and Veronika Morska.

¬´Welcome Ukraine üá∫üá¶¬ª event will be attended by the Ukrainian ambassador and honorary consul, representatives of the city community, Ukrainian military personnel, famous Ukrainian singers, and choirs.

Join us with your families and local friends. We will be happy to meet you at the event, wearing embroidered shirts and with Ukrainian flags! Together we are strong! Slava Ukraine!
entry.summary: ¬´Welcome Ukraine üá∫üá¶¬ª ‚Äî is the biggest event of this spring ‚Äòs-Hertogenbosch, dedicated to Ukraine!

entry.title: Powering Defence: Generators and Charging Stations Delivered to Ukraine

link.title: Powering Defence: Generators and Charging Stations Delivered to Ukraine

entry.content:
Thanks to the joint efforts of the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation and representatives of the Crimean Tatar community, we successfully purchased and delivered essential equipment to support Ukrainian defenders.

What was delivered?

‚Äì ‚úÖ 2 inverter generators (KS 2100 IG S)

‚Äì ‚úÖ 2 EcoFlow Delta 2 charging stations

This equipment has been delivered to the area, where reliable power supply is critical for maintaining communications, operations, and safety.

üí∞ Financial Report:

‚Äì ‚Ç¨1,138 ‚Äì generators

‚Äì ‚Ç¨1,598 ‚Äì charging stations

üìå Funding Source:

These items were purchased using donations collected during the Embassy Festival held on 7 September 2024 in The Hague.

üôè Special Thanks:

We extend heartfelt thanks to Mykhailo and Vasyl for their free and prompt delivery. Your contribution goes far beyond logistics ‚Äî it is real and timely help for those protecting our country.

Together, we stand with Ukraine. Every action counts.

Crimea is Ukraine!

‚Äì February 6, 2025
entry.summary: Thanks to the joint efforts of the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation and representatives of the Crimean Tatar community, we successfully purchased and delivered essential equipment to support Ukrainian defenders.

entry.title: One Year of Solidarity: Over ‚Ç¨185,000 Raised for Ukraine (Feb 2023 ‚Äì Feb 2024)

link.title: One Year of Solidarity: Over ‚Ç¨185,000 Raised for Ukraine (Feb 2023 ‚Äì Feb 2024)

entry.content:
10 March 2024 ‚Äî Over the course of one year, from 24 February 2023 to 24 February 2024, the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation has continued its dedicated work to support Ukrainians affected by Russia‚Äôs full-scale invasion.

In that time, we successfully raised ‚Ç¨185,040 and delivered thousands of kilograms of urgently needed humanitarian aid to families, frontline responders, and vulnerable communities across Ukraine.

Thanks to the generosity of our donors and partners, we were able to send:

  • üõçÔ∏è 7,454 kg of essential items for displaced persons
  • üê∂ 3,079 kg of pet supplies
  • üß¥ 1,177 kg of hygiene products
  • üëö 4,081 kg of clothing
  • üçè 9,112 kg of food
  • üß∏ 1,212 kg of children‚Äôs goods
  • üíª 2,372 electronic devices
  • üíä 14,567 kg of medicines
  • üöó 12 vehicles for transporting aid and saving lives

We are proud of what has been achieved ‚Äî but we know the work is far from over.

üïäÔ∏è This is a long and difficult battle, but together we move steadily forward toward victory.

üëâ We invite everyone who cares about Ukraine to join us ‚Äî by donating, volunteering, or helping spread the word. Every action matters. Every voice counts.

Together, we are stronger. Let us keep fighting ‚Äî and we will overcome. üá∫üá¶

Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation ‚Äì Stichting Oekra√Øners in Nederland

‚Äì March 10, 2024
entry.summary: 10 March 2024 ‚Äî Over the course of one year, from 24 February 2023 to 24 February 2024, the Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation has continued its dedicated work to support Ukrainians affected by Russia‚Äôs full-scale invasion.

entry.title: Modern Medical Equipment Delivered to Chernivtsi Children‚Äôs Hospital

link.title: Modern Medical Equipment Delivered to Chernivtsi Children‚Äôs Hospital

entry.content:
The Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation has donated a state-of-the-art automated blood culture system (bacteriological hemocultivator) worth ‚Ç¨17,500 to the Chernivtsi Regional Children‚Äôs Clinical Hospital (–û–ö–ù–ü "–ß–µ—Ä–Ω—ñ–≤–µ—Ü—å–∫–∞ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∞ –¥–∏—Ç—è—á–∞ –∫–ª—ñ–Ω—ñ—á–Ω–∞ –ª—ñ–∫–∞—Ä–Ω—è").

ü©∏ This automated bacteriological hemocultivator is one of the core diagnostic tools for multidisciplinary hospitals. It plays a vital role in improving the quality and efficiency of medical care, reducing the number of complications and lowering mortality rates among patients with sepsis and fevers of unknown origin.

The device works by analysing blood samples where, in severe infections, microorganisms may multiply. Its use allows for the rapid diagnosis of sepsis in young patients, enabling doctors to prescribe timely and effective treatment.

‚Äì The pathogen can be detected within the first 24 hours of testing.

‚Äì A negative result is confirmed by day 5.

‚Äì In contrast, manual diagnosis can take up to 10 days ‚Äî meaning this system cuts diagnostic time in half.

This life-saving technology will directly impact the lives of vulnerable children in the region ‚Äî and we are proud to support Ukrainian healthcare institutions with such critical tools.

We extend our heartfelt thanks to our generous donors and to Alena Boer, whose support helped make this delivery possible.

Together, we save lives. Together, we support Ukraine.

‚Äì August 15, 2024
entry.summary: The Ukrainians in the Netherlands Foundation has donated a state-of-the-art automated blood culture system (bacteriological hemocultivator) worth ‚Ç¨17,500 to the Chernivtsi Regional Children‚Äôs Clinical Hospital (–û–ö–ù–ü "–ß–µ—Ä–Ω—ñ–≤–µ—Ü—å–∫–∞ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∞ –¥–∏—Ç—è—á–∞ –∫–ª—ñ–Ω—ñ—á–Ω–∞ –ª—ñ–∫–∞—Ä–Ω—è").
